projects.title: Hybrid A*
projects.mainDescr:
üöó Steer Clear with Hybrid A*: Smooth Path Planning in ROS 2 üöÄ
A lightweight, reusable ROS 2 package that computes smooth,
non-holonomic paths through cluttered environments using the
Hybrid A* algorithm‚Äîcomplete with C++ planning, Python-based
map & goal publishers, and live matplotlib visualization.
projects.description:
This project implements a full Hybrid A* path planning pipeline
in ROS 2 Humble:

1. **Environment Generation**
   A Python node (`env_publisher.py`) creates configurable occupancy grids (parking lots, parallel-park, obstacle-course), publishing `/map`, `/start`, and `/goal`.

2. **Hybrid A* Planner**
   A C++ node (`hybrid_astar_node`) subscribes to `/map`, `/start`, and `/goal`, runs a grid-based Dijkstra heuristic, expands motion primitives with sub-step collision checks, then tries a Reeds‚ÄìShepp shortcut. It publishes a smooth `nav_msgs/Path`.

3. **Visualization & Animation**
   A Python node (`path_viz.py`) overlays the computed path and animates a car-shaped rectangle traversing it in matplotlib, and can dump frames for GIF/video creation.

projects.title: Trajectory Generation in Frenet Frame
projects.mainDescr: Sample and score lateral & longitudinal polynomial paths to produce real-time, collision-free vehicle motions‚Äîwith full OpenCV visualization and video output.
projects.description:
Builds a center‚Äêlane reference path (x, y, yaw, curvature, arc-length)
Generates lateral (quintic) & longitudinal (quartic/quintic) polynomial candidates over multiple horizons
Scores each by jerk, time, and deviation, then filters out collisions and kinematic violations
Converts the best trajectory to world coordinates and renders all candidates + selected path with OpenCV (outputs trajectory.mp4)
